subject: Relationships
title: Aristotle's Three Types of Friendship
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Aristotle's Three Types of Friendship.

hook.text: Aristotle classified friendship 2,400 years ago. His framework is still the best one we have.

buildup.text: He identified three types: friendships of utility, of pleasure, and of virtue â€” each with different depths.

discovery.text: Utility friends serve a purpose. Pleasure friends share fun. Virtue friends admire each other's character.

twist.text: Most friendships are utility or pleasure. Virtue friendships â€” the deepest kind â€” are rare and take years to build.

climax.text: Not all friendships need to be deep. But knowing which type you have prevents misplaced expectations.

punchline.text: Aristotle named three kinds of friends. Most of us confuse them.

quiz.question: What is the deepest type of friendship according to Aristotle?
